name: Onion Rava Dosa
history: Rava Dosa is a popular South Indian crepe made from semolina. The addition of onion enhances its flavor, making it a favorite in many households and restaurants.
description: Onion Rava Dosa is a thin, crispy, and savory crepe made from a batter of semolina (rava), rice flour, and all-purpose flour, seasoned with onions and spices. It's a quick and easy dish, often enjoyed with chutney or sambar.

equipment.name: ladle
equipment.description: Used for pouring the batter onto the skillet.

instructions.title: Prepare the Batter
instructions.description: In a mixing bowl, combine rava, rice flour, all-purpose flour, chopped onions, green chilies, cumin seeds, black pepper, curry leaves, and salt. Gradually add water to make a thin batter.

instructions.title: Cook the Dosa
instructions.description: Heat a non-stick skillet or tawa. Pour a ladleful of batter and spread it thinly. Drizzle oil and cook until the dosa is crispy and golden. Flip and cook the other side if desired.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the Onion Rava Dosa hot with coconut chutney or sambar.

tips: Ensure the batter is thin and watery for crispy dosas.
Adding finely chopped coriander leaves can enhance the flavor.
variations: Mix in finely chopped tomatoes or grated carrots for a different taste.
Experiment with different spices like mustard seeds or asafoetida.

storage.shelfLife: Batter can be refrigerated for up to 1 day.
storage.instructions: Store batter in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat dosas on a skillet until crisp.
presentationTips: Garnish with chopped coriander and serve on a traditional banana leaf for an authentic touch.
